title: Donald Barthelme "Forty Stories" book cover
content:
anyone know if this is a font?  
thanks!  
josh

[http://images.amazon.com/images/P/0141180943.01.\_SS500\_SCLZZZZZZZ\_V11203...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907004908/http:/images.amazon.com/images/P/0141180943.01._SS500_SCLZZZZZZZ_V1120388348_.jpg "http://images.amazon.com/images/P/0141180943.01.\_SS500\_SCLZZZZZZZ\_V1120388348\_.jpg")

 [‹ (x) BPD Investigations Unit - (similar to) Windsor {Conor}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907004908/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30144 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Rounded elongated sans - Variable {John Chastain, Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907004908/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30149 "Go to next forum topic")
author: scruggsdesign

comments.content: Gosh that’s hard to tell. The ’a’s look the same, but the ’l’s maybe not. My guess is that someone created it by hand but it could be an actual font - or more than one - with alternates and connectors done by hand. Either way I don’t recognize it, but it’s nice.
